intro: Dichorisandra striatula, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to produce numerous blooms throughout the year under suitable conditions.
